accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], D. W. Newsom Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The D. W. Newsom Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2002.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Joshua A. Kaiser

Encoded by Joshua A. Kaiser
This finding aid is NCEAD compliant.
This collection is unprocessed: materials may not have been ordered and described beyond their original condition.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Duke University alumnus (1899), as well as Trinity College Registrar (1901-1907) and Treasurer (1907-1923). Also, real estate and insurance agent (1923-1949), Durham County Commissioner (1924-1930), as well as the first Durham County Manager (1930-1943).

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Primarily incoming and outgoing personal and business correspondence, bills and receipts, bank statements, and deeds (1890-1950). The material documents Newsom's real estate activities and Durham N.C.'s economic and urban development from the 1920s-1940s. Also includes financial ledgers; scrapbooks of Newsom's newspaper real estate advertisements; notebooks in shorthand; various Newsom family estate papers; and a poem by Newsom, To the Men of the Golden Star, read by him at a World War I memorial service held at Trinity College (1919). The collection contains few records of Newsom's tenure as an official of Trinity College and Durham County. (02-102)

controlaccess.head: Subject Headings
controlaccess.p: These are searchable subject entries for this collection. Performing a search on these subjects in the Duke University Libraries online catalog will bring up other related research materials.

item.subject: Business records North Carolina -- History -- 20th century

processinfo.p: Some of the materials in this accession are not immediately accessible, because they require further processing before use. Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the Rubenstein Library to use this collection.

The labels on the physical folders that comprise this accession reflect Newsom's own labels on original envelopes and other enclosures. However, the folder labels have not been reproduced in the following container list, which describes groups of like items only.
[Technical Services staff may need to reformat newsprint and process materials in envelopes before use.]
[Attention: Contains rusty fasteners and pictorial materials.]

did.unittitle: Deeds of Trust and Bills of Sale, 1923-1929

scopecontent.p: [Newsom served as one of the appraisers reporting on the value of the properties belonging to the Duke Land and Improvement Company, New Hope Realty Company, in Durham.]

processinfo.p: [Technical Services staff may need to reformat newsprint and other brittle paper before use.]
[Attention: Contains rusty fasteners.]

scopecontent.p: [Includes some from Newsom's tenure as Durham County Manager, but the majority are personal, including insurance payments and purchases from the bookstore, florist, etc. Also includes a series of loan passbooks from The Hood System Industrial Bank, Durham, NC.]
